course.title: Learn To Create An RPG Game In Unity
course.subtitle: Game development made easy. Learn C# using Unity and create your very own classic RPG!

reviews.body: This was a very good starting course for making an RPG, but it did leave me wanting more. James is a very good instructor and rather than feel scripted walks through creation with us at a very nice pacing.

James is such an amazing teacher! The way he explained things were easy to follow and fun to watch. The community is super inclusive and will help you if you have any troubles. I'm nervous to start on my own, but as James said, this RPG course gives you all the tool you need to start one. So if you're new, definitely check out this course! Thank you James!

I thought this was the only way to learn how to make an RPG as a beginner in unity.

By the end of it, I was able to learn how to make a basic game in unity. Thanks to this course, I will be able to read and understand other sample files and more.

Thank you very much!

I'm a beginner to Unity and Coding as a whole. I finished one other 2D Unity C# course prior to this one: The contrast of that instructor's performance, organisational skills, speech skills along with practical efficient simplistic but clean code is literally night and day when compared to this instructor James Doyle.

James will demonstrate: Bad habits, awkward pauses during most lectures. I sincerely feel bad for anybody with a decent headset as you'll experience a lot of loud swallowing, drinking pauses and at times confusion from the instructors own lectures as he inputs certain code, to then revisit that code and stare in silence at why something isn't working...

Sorry James, I liked a minimal amount of the content that's available in your course, but unfortunately for readers you'll want to adapt your own code and maybe use his lectures as a way to creatively map out for yourself how to approach something like an RPG for the future.

There's far too many bugs in the end prototype and he doesn't even fix them, instead it was up to various students to come up with ways to fix the spaghetti code.

Research shows James is literally pumping out new content that rehashes similar code, I read his other Udemy course reviews and it becomes apparent quickly that he is in this for the world wide accessible gullible students that will charge over 100$ for a course he demonstrates almost identically with other prototypes on his youtube account.

1/5

A fun course to take to learn the fundamentals of making a classic RPG. There are a few issues, but half of developing is finding out solutions to problems, and most issues (only about 3 main issues with the built game) are fixed in the Q&A section.
This course was a great way to build my beginner knowledge of c# programming as well as game development. There were a few obstacles, but it gave me satisfaction when I figured it out.

Overall, it is good information on creating an RPG Classic Game - it is fairly 'watch me code and copy this', but the course is for beginners - so that's to be expected and I think the instructor is excited about what he teaches.

Pour moi qui n'avait que des connaissances très limitées en programmation (en apprenant sur YouTube à mon rythme) je trouve les explications claires et j'apprends progressivement la syntaxe C# efficacement. Ca donne franchement envi de travailler d'avantage avec Unity, je ne me lasse pas du cours. Vraiment merci et bravo au formateur. C'est rare pour moi d'avoir eu un prof qui donne plaisir à la matière, et qui prend le temps de penser aux problèmes qu'on pourrait rencontrer en tant que débutants et de nous aider à les résoudre.

Les moins : Ca fait 2 fois que je recommence le cours, et ce parce que je n'ai eu de réponses à mes questions (Je try HARD !). Certains utilisateurs ont pris gentillement le temps de m'aider, de bonne volonté, mais au final les solutions proposées par ceux-ci se sont souvent avérées être des béquilles qui ont provoqués d'autres conflis plus tard dans le code. J'aurai donc aimé avoir plus d'assistance de la part du formateur.

Je n'ai pas non plus compris comment consulter les remarques faites par les autres utilisateurs sur la vidéos (à certains moment il est signalé dans la barre d'avancement de la vidéo que certains ont mis des notes ?).

Je suis tout de même très satisfait par le cours.

A good set of basics for creating the systems in a standard JRPG.

As always with Unity courses be aware of the version differences and what problems they will cause you if possible.
Great work, I'll be honest. I don't remember most of this, but at least I'll have a reference and general concepts in the back of my mind as I work on more stuff!

This is a really good course.

It's the second course that I completed by James Doyle.

I really like his courses.

instructor.name: James Doyle
instructor.briefIntroduction:
Hi, I'm James. I have helped thousands of people learn how to develop their own games in Unity, and whether you're a first-time developer, or need to refresh your skills, I can help you learn to make the games you want to make.

With a bachelors degree in Computer Science and a background working in independent game development, I have been helping others to create their own games and release them on multiple platforms.

I believe in helping you learn by teaching code in context, so rather than having to memorize a bunch of stuff you've never seen before, you learn how each coding concept can be applied to real working problems in your games.

I can't wait to help you learn all about making your own games and how to make them a success.

So why not start learning to make games with me now?

See you soon!

James
